msContents.summary: A Karaim translation of the Torah and the Haftarah

ab.title: Leviticus 22
ab.l: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,

‘Speak
to Aaron and to his sons, that they separate themselves from the holy things
of the children of Israel, so that they do not defile my holy name in those things which they
hallow to me. I am the Lord.

Say to them,
“Throughout your generations, any man who will come close, from your offspring, to the holy things that
the children of Israel hallow to the Lord and the uncleanness
is on him: that soul shall be cut off from before me. I am the Lord.

Any man from the offspring of Aaron who is a leper
or has a discharge: he shall not eat of the holy things until he is clean. And the
one who touches anyone with a defiled soul or a man from whom a drop of semen comes out,

Or any man who touches any moving thing
by which he may become unclean, or a man by whom
he may become unclean, whatever his uncleanness:

The soul who touches
him shall be unclean until evening, and shall not eat of the holy things,
unless he washes his body with water.

And when the sun goes down,
he will be clean and after that shall eat of the holy things,
because it is his food.

He shall not eat |an animal| which died or was torn up,
to defile himself by it. I am the Lord.

They shall keep my charge so they will not bear
the punishment of the sin for it and die therefore, if they defile
it. I am the Lord who sanctifies them.

And
any stranger shall not eat the holy thing: a settler of the priest or a hired servant shall not eat
the holy thing.

But if the priest buys |a person| with his silver:
he may eat of it; and the one who is born in his house: they
may eat of his bread.

But if the priest’s daughter becomes a stranger’s,
she may not eat of the heave offering of the holy things.

But
if the priest’s daughter is a widow or divorced and has no offspring and
returns to her father’s house as in her youth,
she shall eat of her father’s bread. But any stranger shall not eat of it.

And a man
who eats of a holy thing by mistake shall add the fifth part of it
to it and shall give it to the priest the holy thing.

And they shall not defile the holy things of the children of Israel
which they separate for the Lord.

And they shall bear,
they themselves, the punishment for the guilt when they eat
their holy things. For I am the Lord who sanctifies them.”’
And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,

‘Speak to Aaron,
and to his sons and to all the children of Israel, and say to them,
“Any man from the house of Israel or of the strangers in Israel
who will bring forward his offering — for all his vows and for all his freewill offerings
which they will bring forward to the Lord for a burnt offering —

For acceptance for you: |it is to be| an unblemished male of the cattle, of the lambs,
or of the goats.

You shall not offer everything that has a blemish,
because it will be not accepted for you.

And a man who brings forward
a sacrifice of peace offerings to the Lord to dedicate his vow or a freewill offering
in cattle or sheep: it shall be unblemished to be accepted.
There shall be no blemish in it.

Blind or broken
or slashed or having a cataract or †swollen
or distorted: you shall not bring forward these to the Lord and
you shall not give an offering by fire of them on the altar to the Lord.

And a bull or a lamb that has a limb too long or †stunted:
you may make it a freewill offering, but for a vow it shall not be accepted.

And that which is †smashed or crushed or torn
or slashed: you shall not bring it forward to the Lord. And you shall not do it in your land.

And the Lord spoke
to Moses, saying,

‘If a bull or a lamb
or a goat is born, then it shall be seven days with its mother,
and from the eighth day and thereafter it will be accepted for you
to bring it forward as an offering by fire to the Lord.

And a bull
or a sheep: you shall not slaughter it and its young on the same day.

And when you will offer a sacrifice of thanksgiving to the Lord,
you shall offer it for your own acceptance.
On that day it shall be eaten. Do not leave any of it until morning. I am the Lord.
And you shall keep my commandments and do them. I am the Lord.

And
you shall not defile my holy name, and my holiness shall be preached
among the children of Israel. I am the Lord who sanctifies you,

Who brought you out from the land of Egypt to be
God to you. I am the Lord.’

app.note: An uncertain translation of quršanɣy, cf. BHeb. גָּרָב ‘eczema and swell of the skin’. Cf. Lev 21:20.
An uncertain translation of čubraɣajny, cf. BHeb. וְקָלוּט ‘or stunted’, ‘or deformed’. Cf. 21:18.
An uncertain translation of ezilǵanni, cf. BHeb. וּמָע֤וּךְ ‘or crushed’, ‘or smashed’.
